cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles W of the Dry Tortugas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northwest through the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the Florida Panhandle/Big Bend area
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle (near or east of Pensacola to Apalachicola)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Alabama/Florida border eastward to Ochlockonee River, FL (north-central Gulf Coast)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in effect (warnings expected farther north later)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: eastern Gulf Coast from the Florida Keys northward through the FL Big Bend and Alabama coastline
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible with gusts 25–35 mph; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (<5% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge 1–2 ft possible along Tampa Bay and west-central FL shoreline during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 8 inches possible, leading to localized flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and a low (but non-zero) risk of an isolated tornado.
